lines.text:
[to the camera]
This never happened to the other fellow.
[last lines]

[Tracy has just been shot and killed]
It's all right. It's quite all right, really. She's having a rest. We'll be going on soon. There's no hurry, you see. We have all the time in the world.
[a bad guy chasing Bond skis into a snow blower, which then spews red snow]
He had a lot of guts.
[after Blofeld hits a tree]
He's branched off.
Merry Christmas, 007.

[as Hillary Bray]
I'm Sir Hillary Bray.

No no no, Mr. Bond. Respectable baronets from the College of Heralds do "not" seduce female patients in clinics. On the other hand, they do get their professional details... "right". The De Bleauchamps tombs are "not" in the Augsburg Cathedral as you said, but in the Ste. Anna Kirch. Sir Hillary Bray would have known!
[Bond looks down and sighs, finally aware that he has been made]

[beat]
Small slip. It takes more than a few props to turn 007 into a Herald.
[breaks Bond's glasses]

[normal voice]
It'll take more than cutting off your earlobes, Blofeld, to turn you into a Count.
I may yet suprise you. But I'm afraid you have no more suprises left for me. I know all about your mission, Mr. Bond.
[Blofeld throws Campbell's mountain climbing equipment at the floor]
Your colleague! Such a keen climber, and a brilliant conversationalist... before he left us.
You realize that he reported where I am.

Oh, I doubt that. In any case, no one is coming to your rescue, Mr. Bond. In a few short hours, the United Nations will receive a Yultide greeting. The information that I now possess the scientific means to control, or to destroy, the economy of the whole world. People will have more important things to deal with than you.
My apologies for the way you were brought here. I wasn't sure you'd accept a *formal* invitation.
There's always something formal about the point of a pistol.
[Bond throws a knife and hits a calendar on a bookshelf, on the 14th day]
But today is the thirteenth, Commander.
I'm superstitious.
She likes you, I can see it.
You must give me the name of your oculist.
Our methods are very exacting. We never like to speak until we're *absolutely* certain that there can be no possibility of error on our side or... forgery on anyone else's.
I hope I can live up to your high standards.
You're hurting me.
I thought that was the idea for tonight.
[first lines]
miniaturization. For instance, radioactive lint. When placed in an opponent's pockets, the anti-personnel and location fix seems fairly obvious.
What we want is a location fix on 007.
Why do you persist in rescuing me, Mr. Bond?
It's becoming quite a habit, isn't it, Contessa Teresa?
Teresa was a Saint; I'm known as Tracy.
Well, Tracy, next time play it safe and stand on 5.
People who want to stay *alive* play it safe.
Please, stay alive! At least for tonight.

[Throws down her hotel room key and gets up to leave]
Come later.
[Draco proposes that Bond marries his daughter]
I find her fascinating. But, she needs a psychiatrist, not me.

[abruptly]
What she needs is a man... to *dominate* her! To make love to her enough to make her love him! A man like you!
I've taught you to love chickens, to love their flesh, their voice.
[a girl writes on Bond's leg under the table, to which Bond makes an awkward face]
Is anything ze matter, Sir Hilary?
Just a slight stiffness coming on... due to the altitude, no doubt.
[M refuses to authorize an attack on Blofeld]
And the girl who helped me escape? We just leave her there?
This department is not concerned with your personal problems.
This department owes her a *debt*. She saved my life.
Operation Bedlam is DEAD! Do you understand, 007?
Yes, Sir. I understand.
[Bond is secretly asking Draco for assistance]
I'd like to interest you in a demolition deal that requires certain aerial activity to install equipment.
[Bond has realized what Blofeld is really up to]
Allergy vaccines? Bacteria. Bacteriological Warfare.
With a difference. Our big breakthrough since last summer has been the confection of a certain... Virus Omega.
Infertility.

TOTAL Infertility! In plants and animals. Not just disease in a few herds, Mr. Bond. Or the loss of a single crop. But the destruction of a whole strain. Forever! Throughout an entire continent. If my demands are not met, I shall proceed with the systematic extinction of whole species of cereals and livestock all over the world!
[Blofeld wants to share his life with Tracy]
Now, if you're very, very nice to me. I could make you my Countess.
But I'm already a Countess.
Whereas if you displease me, I can promise you a very *different* estate.

[Speaking to Grunther in German; translated]
Make sure that everyone is locked up. The guest is not to be disturbed. Even though you didn't find anything in his luggage, be on your watch. The director must not be disturbed.
Unusually small for a Nymphalis polychloros.
I wasn't aware that your expertise included lepidoptery.

Open the compact. Adjust the point of control. Every night at midnight you must be alone. I will tell you what to do. I will tell you how. And once you obey my instructions you will forget them forever. Forever. Forever. Forever...
Miss Moneypenny, have you checked with communications?
Well, replies to our Cairo, Amsterdam and Madrid inquiries - all negative, sir.
The PM wants to be informed personally when we find 007.
Good morning. My name's Bond, James Bond.

[to Bond]
The dame can't pay up.

[to Countess Tracy di Vicenzo]
Forgive me, my mind was elsewhere. Madame, you've forgotten we agreed to be partners this evening.
[Throws chips on the table to pay off her debt]
Please continue.
You're very sure of yourself, aren't you? Suppose I were to kill you for a thrill.
I can think of something more sociable to do.
So, you know your perfumes. What else do you know?
A little about women.
Think about me - as a woman you just bought.
Who needs to buy?
The only thing you need know about me is that I pay my debts.
20,000 francs is a lot of money.
MMMmmm.
[Kisses Bond]
Do not kill me, Mr. Bond. At least not until we've had a drink. And if you wish, I'll give you another chance.
A martini for our guest, Olympe.
A pleasure.
Shaken, not stirred.
Of course.
A Compari, for me.
Listen to me, on the day you marry her, I'll give you a personal dowry of one million pounds in gold.
That's quite an inducement - but, I don't need a million pounds.
Stupido!
And I have a bachelor's taste for freedom.
Please! Just tease her some more. Who knows what will come of it.
You have connections not open to me. Where is Ernst Stavro Blofeld?
Blofeld? Some of my men have recently defected to him. I don't know where he is.
Can you find out?
If I could, I wouldn't tell Her Majesty's Secret Service.
James! Where have you been?
Much too far from you, darling.
Oh, same old James.
[James puts his hands on Moneypenny's behind]
Only more so! Heartless, brute! Letting me pine away without even a postcard.
Pine no more. Cocktails at my place, eightish. Just the two of us.
Aw, I'd adore that. If only I could trust myself.
Same old Moneypenny. Britain's last line of defense.
I'm relieving you from Operation Bedlam, 007.
But, sir, Blofeld's something of a must with me.
You've had two years to run him down.
Does this mean you've lost confidence in me?
I'm well aware of your talents, 007. But Licensed to Kill is *useless* - unless one can set up a target. I'll find you a more suitable assignment. That's all.
That was a quick conference. How do you expect a girl to keep herself alluring...
Take a memo, please, Moneypenny.
Ready, James.
Sir, I have the honor to request you will accept my resignation, effective forthwith.
Resignation from what?
Her Majesty's Secret Service. And kindly present it to that monument in there.
Moneypenny, what would I do without you?
My problem is that you never do anything with me.
Tracy, I was always taught that mistakes should be remedied, especially between friends - or lovers.
Just keep my martini cool.
Provide him with the usual comforts.
Ya!
What will you drink sir?
Malt whiskey and branch water, please.
Your stiffness - of last night - it is all gone?
For the time being, I think.
Come, girls. It is time for our massage.
Once they're warned, you'll have a problem dispensing the stuff.
That problem has already been solved. I've been training my own special - angels of death.
Those girls.
Those girls - and many others like them.
But exactly how?
That will remain my secret.
You perverse British. How you love your exercise.
crescent moons, portcullis, beasts, cochons, rampants, bars, bezants.
Please, what is bezants?
Gold balls. I brought a book on the subject with me. There's a picture of my own coat of arms, actually - which includes four of them. If you'd care to see them.
I'd love to!
Maybe he didn't see me.
I wouldn't go banco on that.
Giving up bad habits, eh?
Why are they looking for you?
I suspect, they're trying to kill me.
Thank you, Tracy. You've got sharp eyes and beautiful - ear lobes.
Good girl!
Her Majesty's Secret Service is still my job.
But, there isn't anything you can do about your job at the moment, is there?
No.
Then why are you thinking about it now?
I'm not. I'm thinking about us.

[Placing a phone call]
Hello, Draco.
Yes, who is it?
Bond, James Bond.
Take me to the Alpine Room.
Are you unhappy here?
I want to see the dawn.
So - poetic a pleasure. What were all the world's charms to mighty Paris, when he found that dawn in the arms of his Helen?

Thy dawn, O Master of the World, thy dawn; For thee the sunlight creeps across the lawn, For thee the ships are drawn down to the waves, For thee the markets throng with myriad slaves, For thee the hammer on the anvil rings, For thee the poet of beguilement sings.
Go and get the brandy. Five star Hennessy, of course.
Look, James, I know that we haven't always exactly seen, well, anyway, don't forget, if there's anything you ever need...
Thank you, Q, but, this time I've got the gadgets
[looks over towards Tracy]
and I know how to use them.
Delicious! I used to hate chicken. Used to make me break out. It was all over. You'd be surprised where.
